next.title: Galaxy Distances in the Local Universe

question.label: Look at the images of Supernovae 4, 5, and 6 again. Compare the relative size of each galaxy with the distance to the supernova in that galaxy. What relationship exists between the apparent size of the galaxy and its distance from Earth?

The Andromeda Galaxy (M31) is the closest large galaxy to the Milky Way. It is at a distance of 2.5 MLY (0.78 Mpc) from Earth. Approximately how many times farther away is Supernova 4 compared to M31?
